result.execSummary:
The defendant Myron Mobley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

- No Contact with Regina T.
- Perform 30 hours of community service.
- Maintain employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myron Mobley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Myron Mobley in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Myron Mobley in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Judge Protasiewicz is in trial on another matter.  There is no spin ADA available.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Myron Mobley in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Case to remain on the jury trial calendar.

Defendant Myron Mobley in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court reiterated the no contact order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possesion or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Regina T.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Myron Mobley in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

03/29/2015
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/1/15 @ 1:30 pm
